page.title: 20LITTLE WENLOCK
page.content: L. Wenlock is a village on a hill. A 14 year old resident, Graham Tart, said of it, in the winter: "It is often cut off, but is soon dug out of the snow, by the farmers who live in and around it." More ominously he says that the village is surrounded by " a radius of countryside, of 1.5 miles, which seems to be getting smaller as Telford gets bigger." An 80 year old resident of L. Wenlock, Mrs. Goodall, remarked that she didn't think it was a village 'anymore'. When she was a girl, back in the 1920's, her family had a 'pony and float'. Nowadays, most houses have at least one car. The roads into the village may still be narrow and windy, but the M54's proximity, encourages commuters to Birmingham, and hikers who descend on the village in summer.
